snippet: Florian Homm, arrested last year on a United States warrant, was released from prison and returned to Germany, his lawyer said.
abstract: Florian Homm, German hedge fund manager wanted on securities fraud charges in the United States, is released from an Italian jail following ruling from Italian supreme court; Homm returns to Germany, where he is safe from extradition, marking serious setback for United States prosecutors; Homm, a former manager of Absolute Capital, also faces a civil suit by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome and Hiroko Tabuchi from New York.

lead_paragraph: Florian Homm, arrested last year on a United States warrant, was released from prison and returned to Germany, his lawyer said.

headline.main: Indicted German Financier Freed in Italy
headline.print_headline: German Financier, Indicted in U.S., Is Set Free by Italy
